title: Understanding Google Sheets
text: Google Sheets is an online spreadsheet tool, allowing you to view and edit data from your browser.

title: Starting Point
text: Begin by opening a new Google Sheets spreadsheet. This sets up a blank canvas for your data.

title: Importing Files
text: You can import files into Google Sheets. Locate the 'File' menu on the toolbar; it often holds the import feature.

title: Understanding Formats
text: Excel files, typically ending with '.xlsx', can be directly imported into Google Sheets without converting to other formats.

hintAnswer: Open a new Google Sheets spreadsheet and import the Excel file
title: Direction to Check
text: Use the 'Import' tool from the 'File' menu to select and open your Excel file directly in Google Sheets.
choices: Open a new Google Sheets spreadsheet and import the Excel file
Convert the Excel spreadsheet to an .ods file, then import to Google Sheets.
Install the Excel add on to Google Sheets.
Save the Excel file as a .pdf file, then upload to Google Sheets.
